intro: Jatropha capensis, commonly known as the Natal buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. Jatropha capensis is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in warm, sunny conditions. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
